Module com.example.project3
Package com.example.project3

Class TransactionManagerController

java.lang.Object
com.example.project3.TransactionManagerController
public class TransactionManagerController extends Object
Transaction Manager Controller contains the button click actions and functionality of our Transaction Manager GUI These functionalities include opening, closing, depositing, withdrawing from accounts, cancel and clear buttons, etc.
Author:
Palak Singh, Daniel Guan

    Checking or Money Market radio button selected disables campus and loyalty selection

    For when the clear button is clicked on the Deposit/Withdraw tab Clears all input fields (first name, last name, date, etc.) and selections on the Deposit/Withdraw tab

    For when the clear button is clicked on the Open/Close tab Clears all input fields (first name, last name, date, etc.) and resets all the selections on the Open/Close tab

    closeButtonClicked()
    For when the close button is clicked Method to process the inputs and close a valid account that is in the database already.

    Load accounts from a .txt file and starts to read it using BufferReader

    openButtonClicked()
    For when the open button is selected Method to process the inputs, create and open a new valid account that is not in the database already.
    protected void
    printAllButtonClicked()
    For when the Print All Accounts button is clicked Prints all accounts in database (sorted by accounts) in the output text field
    protected void
    printInterestFeesButtonClicked()
    For when the Print Fees and Interests button is clicked Prints each accounts' interest and fees in the output text field
    protected void
    savingsSelected()
    Savings radio button selected enables loyalty selection and disables campus selection

    For when the Update Accounts button is clicked Prints all accounts in the database, with updated balances, into the output text field
